column1: Skin abscesses are common and affect people of all ages.

Skin abscesses may occur after: - A bacterial infection (often staphylococcus) - A minor wound or injury - Boils - Folliculitis (infection in a hair follicle) A skin abscess may occur anywhere on the body.

Symptoms may include: - Fever or chills, in some cases - Local swelling around the infected spot - Hardened skin tissue - Skin lesion that may be an open or closed sore, or a raised area - Redness, tenderness, and warmth in the area - Fluid drainage
